commentBody:
Humans make mistakes, that's why we forgive one another. Most of the time, we suffer the consequences of our decisions alone and with a few close to us. But sometimes, decisions affect all of us. We would hope that affect advanced our well-being, our sense of human unity. To leverage beneficial decision-making, we choose to adhere to a set of human values, globally recognized by all religions as treating others as yourself. Acting within this value advances civilization. It's worked pretty well.

When decisions are make outside of respect for all others, the consequences may negatively impact everyone. It's this lack of respect for others represented by Mr. Bannon's history that places him squarely outside of the protection of basic human values. This alone should be enough to disqualify him as chief strategist for the Trump administration.
